column4: ubuntu stores the hash, not the cleartext, so unfortunatly no, ... if the password is a dictionary word (probably not - as any good IT person would use a combination of letters and numbers ) you could run the hash through a dcrypt program against a large database of words... again probably wouldn't work but you could try
ok, thanks.. i guessed that was the case. then im boned. guess i have to try find the paper where the password is written down :)
are you the administrator of your router?
yeah,  but we lost the password of the router  as well,, and we wanted to avoid reconfigure it
